articles.summary: As India’s digital footprint expands, more and more people are grappling with non-substance addictions like excessive internet use, gaming, smartphone and social media dependence.

articles.summary: The opening day of the India AI Impact Summit 2026 in New Delhi unfolded as a landmark moment in the

articles.summary: As India advances from experimenting with AI to production of AI, technology chiefs across India’s startup ecosystem are working on

articles.title: Karnataka eyes deeper ties with France across AI, aerospace, defence
articles.summary: Karnataka IT/BT minister Priyank Kharge said Bengaluru could serve as a gateway for French companies entering India, following talks with France’s AI and digital affairs minister Anne Le Hénaff. Discussions focused on collaboration in skills, innovation, AI, aerospace, defence, and startup ecosystems. The meeting also explored establishing innovation and skills corridors.

articles.title: Explained | RBI to tighten lending norms for brokers from April 1 — key changes and impact
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India will mandate full collateral for banks lending to capital market intermediaries from April 1, 2026, tightening exposure norms and prohibiting proprietary trading funding.

articles.title: India’s first sovereign AI box aims to localise enterprise intelligence
articles.summary: Indian AI-native transformation foundry Arinox AI and agentic AI company KOGO, unveiled what they describe as India’s first sovereign AI product

articles.title: Adani to invest $100 billion in AI data centres by 2035
articles.summary: Indian conglomerate ​Adani Enterprises said ‌on ⁠Tuesday ⁠the ​group ​will ​invest $100 ⁠billion ‌to ​build ​renewable energy-powered ⁠AI-ready data ​centres ​by ‌2035.

articles.title: AI agents start shopping: Mastercard unlocks agentic commerce in India
articles.summary: Even as India’s digital payments ecosystem continues to expand at an unmatched scale, it now finds new territory.

articles.title: High income tax collections show middle class is expanding, not being crushed: Sitharaman
articles.summary: Sitharaman said rising personal income tax collections reflect middle-class expansion and formalisation, not distress, citing a doubling of taxpayers, higher exemptions and record-low inflation.

articles.title: 'US tariff cut may lift GDP by 20-30 bps', say economists
articles.summary: India's economy is set for a boost as the US lowers tariffs on Indian goods. This move is expected to increase India's GDP by 20-30 basis points next fiscal year. Key sectors like gems and jewellery, textiles, and marine products will see improved exports. The rupee is also likely to stabilize with increased foreign investment.

articles.title: Adani Enterprises gains 3% on $100 billion AI infrastructure investment announcement
articles.summary: Adani Enterprises announced a $100 billion investment for AI infrastructure in India by 2035, deepening partnership with Flipkart, Google, and Microsoft, boosting shares and expanding renewable energy projects.

articles.title: French authorities probe Nestlé, Danone, Lactalis over contaminated baby formula
articles.summary: Paris' public prosecutor said the inquiries target potential charges of “deception regarding goods posing a danger to human health," which carries penalties of up to seven years in prison and fines of up to €3.75 million ($4.45 million).

articles.title: India to get same yarn, cotton benefits as Bangladesh in US trade deal: Goyal
articles.summary: Piyush Goyal assures India’s textile and farm sectors are protected in the US trade deal, with reciprocal tariff cuts and equal cotton benefits as Bangladesh, targeting major export growth.

articles.title: India targets $200 billion data center investment to power AI ambitions
articles.summary: India aims to draw up to $200 billion in data center investments to become an AI hub, with tax breaks, 38,000 shared GPUs and major commitments from Google, Microsoft and Amazon.

articles.title: Refinery petrochemical integration, feedstock certainty to define India’s next chemical growth cycle: Ramya Bharathram, MD, Thirumalai Chemicals
articles.summary: In an interview, she outlines reforms in cracker configuration, supply agreements and carbon strategy to move India up the global chemical value chain.

articles.title: Govt looking to build consensus on the challenges between AI and copyright: Ashwini Vaishnaw
articles.summary: Large AI models have been commercially rolled out by global players like ChatGPT of OpenAI, Google's Gemini, etc.The minister said investors are also bullish on India and have finalised investment of over Rs 20,000 crore, which will materialise over the next 1-2 years.

articles.title: Delhi’s Bhu-Aadhaar: How 14-Digit ULPIN digital mapping may transform land records
articles.summary: Delhi government launches Bhu-Aadhaar, assigning unique 14-digit ULPINs to land parcels. Rekha Gupta calls it a revolutionary step for Digital India, aiming to reduce disputes and modernise records.

articles.title: India AI Summit to address job risks, reskilling needs: MeitY Secretary
articles.summary: S Krishnan, Secretary at the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), said several companies have indicated interest in making investment announcements at the summit, adding that while the government has not specifically sought such declarations, announcements are expected.

articles.title: E-Commerce and travel sectors lead in consumer refunds, govt data reveals ₹52 crore returned
articles.summary: India’s National Consumer Helpline resolved 79,521 refund complaints, securing ₹52 crore in refunds, mostly from e-commerce and travel sectors.

articles.title: India ahead in digital revolution, PM Modi, Andhra CM playing key role: Bill Gates
articles.summary: Microsoft founder Bill Gates on Monday said India was ahead in the digital revolution and credited Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu with playing a key role in it.

articles.title: Hate speech PIL 'targets' BJP CMs: Supreme Court
Cash craze: Currency in circulation touches record Rs 40 lakh crore
articles.summary: The amount of cash circulating in the economy has hit an all-time peak of Rs 40 lakh crore in January, after rising 11.1% year-on-year. Yet, interestingly, the cash-to-GDP ratio has dipped, suggesting that digital payments are playing a much bigger role than before.

articles.title: Adani bets big on AI data centres, to invest $100bn
articles.summary: Adani Group plans a massive $100 billion investment by 2035 to establish renewable energy-powered, AI-ready data centers across India. This initiative aims to foster a $250 billion AI infrastructure ecosystem, building on existing partnerships and expanding renewable energy capacity to support India's ambition as an AI hub.

articles.title: India’s next big power move is set to unfold in the Bay of Bengal
articles.summary: India's ambitious Great Nicobar infrastructure project has received a green light. This mega project, centered around a new transshipment port, aims to boost India's role in global shipping. It will reduce reliance on foreign ports and strengthen India's strategic presence near vital sea lanes.

articles.title: Torrent Power to acquire Nabha Power from L&T for ₹6,889 crore
articles.summary: Nabha Power owns and operates a 1,400 MW (2x700 MW) supercritical coal-fired thermal power plant at Rajpura in Patiala district, Punjab.

articles.title: Tax breaks offer legal certainty for companies:  Amazon’s chief global affairs officer David Zapolsky
articles.summary: India represents a long-term strategic bet for Amazon, which has invested more than $40 billion in the country since 2010 and committed an additional $35 billion in the coming years, the company’s chief global affairs and legal officer said.

articles.title: Delhivery bets bigger on electric deliveries after pilot cuts rider costs
articles.summary: The latest deployment follows a pilot in Delhi-NCR and Bengaluru, where the use of RIDEV’s electric two-wheelers reduced 4,260 kg of carbon dioxide emissions and cut riders’ daily operating costs by more than 50%.

articles.title: American chipmaker Micron to begin commercial production in India by month-end: Meity official
articles.summary: Speaking at the IndiaAI Impact Summit, Krishnan said US-based Micron is working on high bandwidth memory, a key component necessary for widening AI usage.

articles.title: CEA Nageswaran warns AI could deepen inequality without rapid workforce skilling
articles.summary: India's Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran warned that AI is no longer just "a debate about future of work" and will pressure the country into upskilling its workforce to create millions of job opportunities.

articles.title: India focused on practical applications of AI to solve population-scale challenges: Vaishnaw
articles.summary: Speaking at a research symposium at the AI Impact Summit, the minister also expressed happiness over the strong participation and optimism shown by young people at an AI Expo on Tuesday.

articles.title: India has to translate research into products to build deep tech ecosystem: Kris Gopalakrishnan
articles.summary: India needs to translate its research into tangible products and technology to develop a robust deep tech ecosystem and achieve its long-term goal of becoming a developed nation by 2047, Kris Gopalakrishnan, Chairman of Axilor Ventures and cofounder of Infosys, said on the sidelines of the India AI Impact Summit.

articles.title: India's moment, nation is leading, building technology: Intel India MD on AI Summit
articles.summary: The AI Summit marks a defining moment for India, a stage where the nation is not following key technologies but preparing to lead by building solutions unlike anywhere else in the world, Santhosh Viswanathan, Vice President Managing Director, India Region, Intel said on Tuesday.

articles.title: Difficult, painful to lose exhibits at AI Impact Summit, India will learn, improve: NeoSapien cofounder
articles.summary: After sparking a social media buzz over stolen exhibits at the AI Impact Summit, homegrown wearables startup NeoSapien cofounder and CEO Dhananjay Yadav believes India will learn from the incident and improve.

articles.title: India investing in small AI models for resource efficiency, says Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu
articles.summary: Vembu said that the current trend in India is to focus on models that use fewer resources. He stated, "I think we are investing in lot of the smaller models. Those should be unglamorous right now, but they get the job done." He mentioned the startup Sarvam as an example of a company already launching models with a smaller footprint.

articles.title: India's tougher AI social media rules spark censorship fears
articles.summary: India has tightened rules governing the use of artificial intelligence on social media to combat a flood of disinformation, but also prompting warnings of censorship and an erosion of digital freedoms. With more than a billion internet users, India is grappling with AI-generated disinformation swamping social media.

articles.title: India Deep Tech Alliance pencils $1 billion for AI as members plan $2.5 billion play
articles.summary: The India Deep Tech Alliance (IDTA) is set to announce increased investments in the artificial intelligence and deeptech ecosystem on Tuesday. IDTA members have collectively committed more than $2.5 billion over five years, with $1 billion earmarked for AI deployment within three years, IDTA chair Arun Kumar told ET.

articles.title: India is becoming ElevenLabs’ key growth engine as enterprises scale voice AI: CEO Mati Staniszewski
articles.summary: India is already the second-largest market for ElevenLabs and is fast turning into one of its biggest growth engines, as enterprises scale voice artificial intelligence across customer service, sales and operations, the company’s cofounder and chief executive Mati Staniszewski said.

articles.title: D-Street’s new-age firms strike a profit note
articles.summary: Nine of India’s top 12 new-age firms grew revenues by 25% or more in October–December, driven by wider market reach and rising digital demand. Eternal, owner of Zomato and Blinkit, tripled its revenue, while Swiggy, Ather Energy, Lenskart, PB Fintech, Meesho and Nykaa saw 25–54% growth. Profits also rose at Nykaa, Eternal, Delhivery and Paytm.

articles.title: At mega AI Summit in Delhi, Goa seeks deeptech, semiconductor investments
articles.summary: Banking on the Centre's ambitious India AI Mission unveiled alongside a major industry summit in New Delhi, Goa is positioning itself as an emerging hub for artificial intelligence, deep-tech research and semiconductor-linked sectors, a state minister said on Monday.

articles.title: X outage: Users report website and app issues
articles.summary: Elon Musk’s social media platform X faced another outage, the second month in a row. Over 3,000 complaints were reported in India on Monday evening, with most users experiencing website issues, while others struggled with the app or feed. The cause remains unclear, and the company has not given an explanation.

articles.title: Indian AI, gaming startups take centre stage at AI Impact Summit 2026, showcasing cutting-edge innovations
articles.summary: Among the standout participants are five Indian ventures -- Yesgnome, Metasports (Hitwicket), Koyozo, Youth Buzz (Ourcadium) and Evivve -- each presenting unique AI-driven solutions that are reshaping gaming, creative production, and enterprise transformation.

articles.title: India's textile and apparel exports down by 3.75% in January, outlook improves now with India US interim deal
articles.summary: India's textile and apparel exports saw a dip in January. High tariffs from the United States impacted shipments. However, a recent reduction in these tariffs is expected to boost export competitiveness. This change should support a recovery in textile and apparel shipments in the coming months. The sector's share in India's total exports also saw a decline.

articles.title: Gold, silver import surge pushes India’s January trade deficit to 3-month high of $34.68 billion
articles.summary: Surging gold and silver imports widened India’s January trade deficit to $34.68 billion. Imports jumped 19% while exports barely grew, with services offering limited relief amid weak global demand.

articles.title: Unemployment rate up a tad to 5% in January, higher rise for females
articles.summary: India's unemployment rate saw a slight increase in January, reaching 5%. Joblessness rose more significantly for women compared to men. Rural unemployment edged up, while urban unemployment also increased. The labour force participation rate experienced a minor dip. Youth unemployment also saw a rise, primarily driven by female joblessness.

articles.title: Wholesale inflation touches 10-month high of 1.8% in January
articles.summary: India's wholesale inflation reached a 10-month peak of 1.81 percent in January. This rise was fueled by higher costs for food, non-food articles, and manufactured goods. Retail inflation also saw its first reading under a new series. Economists noted a gradual increase in inflation since October 2025. The core WPI segment showed a significant jump.

articles.title: India’s trade deficit widens to $34.68 billion in January as gold imports rise
articles.summary: India's trade deficit surged in January, driven by higher gold and silver imports. Merchandise exports saw a slight dip. However, overall goods and services exports are projected to exceed $860 billion for the fiscal year. Trade pacts with the UAE and EU offer future export growth opportunities. US tariff reductions are expected to boost Indian exports.

articles.title: India’s unemployment rate rises marginally to 5% in January
articles.summary: India's unemployment rate rose to 5% in January. This increase was primarily seen in rural areas. The joblessness rate edged up from 3.9% to 4.2% in villages. Urban unemployment also saw a slight rise. Labour force participation and worker population ratios declined. Seasonal factors and post-harvest slack contributed to the rural slowdown. Urban areas remained stable.

articles.title: China's Russian oil imports to hit new record in February as India cuts back
articles.summary: China's Russian oil imports are set to reach a new record high in February, surpassing January's figures. Independent refiners are increasingly purchasing discounted Russian crude as India reduces its purchases, driven by concerns over potential U.S. strikes on Iran and the relative competitiveness of Russian supplies.

articles.title: India wholesale inflation at 9-month high of 1.81% in January; up from 0.83% in December
articles.summary: In January, India witnessed a surge in wholesale price inflation, hitting a nine-month high of 1.81%. This uptrend can be attributed to escalating costs across basic metals, manufactured goods, and agricultural sectors, with food inflation also on the rise. Concurrently, retail inflation edged up to 2.75%, driven by the rising costs of food and precious metals.

articles.title: A bite too big? Orchard anxiety for farmers as US apples could crowd Indian shelves
articles.summary: Apple cultivators in India stand at a crossroads as a recent trade agreement with the US and a surge in imported fruits jeopardise their existence. The local apple sector is grappling with soaring logistics expenses and significant losses post-harvest. There's an urgent call for transformative strategies to streamline supply chains and enhance productivity.

articles.title: India's sugar exports reach 2.01 lakh tonnes till February in 2026 MY: AISTA
articles.summary: India has exported over 200,000 tonnes of sugar by February in the current marketing year. The United Arab Emirates is the leading destination for these shipments. The government has approved a total of 2 million tonnes for export this year. This includes an additional 500,000 tonnes recently permitted. Sugar production is projected to increase significantly.

articles.title: India at a ‘defining moment’: Tech and trade to drive next growth phase, says Jitin Prasada
articles.summary: India is at a crucial economic juncture. Technology and trade are powering its growth. The nation is building robust digital infrastructure and promoting domestic manufacturing. Free trade deals are opening global markets. The government is committed to safeguarding citizens and supporting farmers and small businesses. India is poised for significant advancement.

articles.title: ET Now GBS 2026: Maharashtra $1-trillion push needed for India's $5-trillion economy quest
articles.summary: Placing the state's target alongside India's broader goal of becoming a $5-trillion economy by 2030 and a developed nation by 2047, state industry secretary P Anbalagan said Maharashtra's trajectory broadly mirrors national trends but will require a sharper push.

articles.title: Visible shift northern & Eastern districts power India's growth path
articles.summary: India's economy is growing beyond big cities. New areas in northern and eastern states are becoming economic hubs. This is according to the City Vitality Index for Q1 2026. Established metros still lead, but emerging districts are showing strong growth. This indicates a shift in economic activity across the country.

articles.title: Silver jumps Rs 4,500/kg, gold rebounds despite easing US-Iran tensions. What should your strategy be?
articles.summary: Gold and silver futures saw an upward opening on MCX on Wednesday. This occurred even as progress in US-Iran talks eased geopolitical tensions, reducing safe-haven demand for precious metals. Analysts suggest caution due to market volatility. Physical gold prices varied across major Indian cities. Investors are advised to avoid fresh positions this week.

articles.title: ETMarkets Smart Talk | Financials, manufacturing and consumption to lead in 2026 as India’s structural story strengthens: Raghav Iyengar
articles.summary: Indian equity markets are set for a strong future. Domestically driven sectors like financials, manufacturing, and consumption will lead growth. By 2026, structural growth themes will overshadow market noise. Investors can anticipate improved earnings visibility and supportive liquidity. This period promises sustained wealth creation for long-term participants.

articles.title: What lies ahead for Indian IT as brokerages reevaluate growth prospects?
articles.summary: Brokerages Nomura and UBS assess the impact of AI on Indian IT stocks, with Nomura suggesting current sell-offs are front-loading pains and UBS highlighting the importance of adapting to AI. Both acknowledge transition challenges but see potential for stock floors due to cash flows and dividends. Adaptability to AI adoption and pricing model shifts will be crucial for future valuations.

articles.title: More leveraged deals, lower base effect spur brokerage recovery in Q3
articles.summary: Indian stockbrokers saw improved revenues and profits in the third quarter. Trading volumes increased, boosted by leveraged deals and higher interest income. Exchanges like BSE and NSE also reported growth. This performance was supported by strong activity in cash and derivatives markets, as well as healthy primary market participation. Volatility in commodities also lifted trading volumes.

articles.title: US stocks | Trading platform eToro beats profit estimates on robust market activity
articles.summary: eToro surpassed fourth-quarter profit expectations, driven by robust capital market activity that boosted trading income. The platform saw a notable shift as crypto-native customers began trading commodities, indicating a convergence of investment strategies. Despite a dip in net contribution, the company's assets under administration grew significantly.

articles.title: India needs an AI creation metric to weigh progress, says Kore.ai founder Raj Koneru
articles.summary: India needs to start measuring how much artificial intelligence it creates, not just how many data centres it builds or how much AI it consumes, Raj Koneru, founder and CEO of Kore.ai, said on Tuesday.

articles.title: India’s chance to create AI’s third way: Mozilla Foundation president Mark Surman
articles.summary: There is a huge opportunity for countries like India to step forward and be champions in artificial intelligence by investing in open source and enabling the creation of a third way of AI that is different from Big Tech and China, Mozilla Foundation president Mark Surman said.

articles.title: AI could make traditional jobs obsolete by 2050: Vinod Khosla
articles.summary: Indian-American investor Vinod Khosla predicted that by 2050, traditional jobs may become largely unnecessary as AI advances across industries. He warned that white-collar roles and outsourcing firms could face major disruption within the next five to ten years. Khosla said the future of work will be fundamentally reshaped by AI.

articles.title: Balancing AI and copyright; Adani's $100B bet
articles.summary: Day 2 of the India AI Impact Summit featured additional announcements, sessions, and policy discussions focused on emerging technology. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: India represents remarkable opportunity in AI transformation in health: Royal Philips CEO
articles.summary: Jakobs said globally healthcare systems, including in India are facing unprecedented pressure due to rising demand, growing complexity, stretched workforces and this pressure would have accelerated the adoption of data and AI-driven innovations. A shift has already begun in that direction for creating an intelligent health system, he said in his address.

articles.title: Qualcomm showcases humanoid robotics at AI Impact Summit
articles.summary: Qualcomm on Tuesday showcased its robotics technologies, including humanoid systems, at the India AI Impact Summit 2026, at Bharat Mandapam in the national capital.

articles.title: India’s AI usage concentrated in tech-heavy states: Anthropic executive Elizabeth Kelly
articles.summary: At the AI Summit 2026, Anthropic executive Elizabeth Kelly said India ranks second globally in overall Claude usage, though per capita it stands 101st out of 116 countries. Use is concentrated in tech-heavy states like Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka and Delhi. She stressed benefits must be widely shared beyond a narrow segment.

articles.title: AI-enabled education key to global leadership, youth enthusiasm high: Dharmendra Pradhan
articles.summary: Emphasising the government's vision, the minister said, "It is our duty to provide AI-enabled education to India's new generation." He added that increasing AI-skilled personnel in the country would help India move towards a position of global leadership. Director of IIT Madras, V. Kamakoti, elaborated on the twin approach of 'AI in Education' and 'Education in AI.' He said discussions during the panel focussed particularly on how AI tools can enhance learning outcomes.

articles.title: Earnings set for strong rebound in FY27 after weak FY26, says Mahesh Nandurkar
articles.summary: Indian investors are learning the importance of diversifying beyond domestic equities. Mahesh Nandurkar of Jefferies highlights the need for global exposure. He also notes the Union Budget has become less of a market mover. Corporate earnings are expected to significantly improve next year, driven by factors like inflation and stabilizing interest rates. Nandurkar is optimistic about future market growth.

articles.title: AI job fears trigger IT selloff; Unmesh Sharma sees opportunity for Indian IT, not doom
articles.summary: Indian technology stocks experienced a sharp decline following AI breakthroughs. However, an expert highlights that India's strength lies in AI implementation rather than core innovation. Electronics manufacturing services are identified as a multi-year growth sector. Investors are advised to navigate volatility with a focus on structural themes and disciplined positioning for future gains.

articles.title: School assembly news headlines Feb 4: Top national, international, sports, business update and thought of the day
articles.summary: India and the US finalized a significant trade deal, boosting the rupee and leading to discussions on oil procurement and tariff adjustments. Meanwhile, national headlines include political developments, a tragic incident involving a Bengaluru CEO, and aviation safety concerns. Internationally, Russia's assault on Ukraine continues, and Pakistan faces challenges with defense deals and internal security.

articles.title: Gold rally prompts profit-taking; AI fears overdone, Indian IT a buy: Matt Orton
articles.summary: Matt Orton, Chief Market Strategist at Raymond James Investment, believes the market’s recent negative reaction to rapid advances in artificial intelligence is exaggerated. In his view, the sharp pullback has created attractive opportunities in high-quality sectors such as Indian IT services. He also expects a short-term market shakeout, which he sees as a potential buying opportunity for investors willing to look beyond near-term volatility.

articles.title: Mitessh Thakkar suggests buy calls on Bank of India, Adani Green, GAIL; recommends selling MCX
articles.summary: On Wednesday, market tech analyst Mitessh Thakkar recommended these stocks for the short term.

articles.title: After backlash, Galgotias University says Chinese robodog was bought for learning, denies building it
articles.summary: Galgotias University clarified it did not develop the Robodog shown at AI Impact Summit in New Delhi, but bought it from China's Unitree for academic use, aiming to inspire innovation.

articles.title: Food Secretary: India's sugar supply "comfortably" placed despite production estimates down by 13 LT
articles.summary: India's sugar production is estimated at 330 LT, with consumption at 290 LT, ensuring surplus. AISTA reports 2.01 LT exports in 2025-26, mainly to UAE, Afghanistan, Djibouti, and Bhutan.

articles.title: Gokaldas Exports expects 12-15% revenue growth in FY27 as US sourcing returns
articles.summary: Gokaldas Exports is expanding in Europe and continuing diversification. It also plans capex of around ₹175 crore over two years and is open to expansion through acquisitions. Management said trade deals and tariff normalisation could support textile exports and jobs growth.

articles.title: Why India’s cash in circulation hit ₹40 lakh crore despite record UPI surge? Check here
articles.summary: India’s currency in circulation hits ₹40 lakh crore, while UPI transactions reach ₹28.3 lakh crore monthly. SBI Research notes digital payments are driving incremental GDP growth amid rising cash.

articles.title: India’s unemployment rate rises to 5% in January 2026
articles.summary: India’s unemployment rate rose to 5% in January 2026, with overall labour force participation rate (LFPR) at 55.9% and worker population ratio (WPR) at 53.1%. Urban and rural workforce participation remained largely stable as did female LFPR, month-on-month.

articles.title: India's trade deficit soars to record high as gold imports surge
articles.summary: For the April–January period, merchandise exports rose 2.22% to $366.63 billion, while imports climbed 7.21% to $649.86 billion, keeping the deficit elevated.

articles.title: Bill Gates meets Andhra CM Naidu in Amaravati ahead of AI Impact Summit; discusses health, agri, and tech
articles.summary: Bill Gates visited Amaravati, met Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu to discuss health, agriculture, and tech collaboration ahead of the AI Impact Summit in New Delhi.

articles.title: India’s wholesale inflation rises to 10-month high in January
articles.summary: India's wholesale inflation rose to 1.81% in January from 0.83%, mainly due to higher food prices and increased manufacturing sector costs. Certain kitchen items remain significantly cheaper than a year ago.

articles.title: ‘Extremely concerned’ about global aid cuts: Rockerfeller’s Raj Shah warns of millions of needless deaths
articles.summary: As major countries like the US, UK and France execute deep cuts to their aid budgets and turn a blind eye to climate change, the world will become less capable of handling a pandemic or a major food crisis, Raj Shah, President of the Rockefeller Foundation, said in an interview with CNBC-TV18. He warned that reduced global aid could cause 23 million deaths by 2030, affecting India. However, he saw some hope in private sector participation.

articles.title: January inflation at 2.75%: economists flag food risks, RBI likely to stay on pause
articles.summary: Sameer Narang, Head of Economics Research at ICICI Bank, said the shift in inflation trends is more notable than the headline print. He highlighted that food inflation has turned positive after months of deflation, while core inflation appears softer under the new series, particularly when gold and silver are excluded.

articles.title: New CPI series reflects changing spending patterns, may make inflation less volatile: CEA
articles.summary: CEA Anantha Nageswaran said the new CPI better reflects changing consumption patterns, may reduce inflation volatility, and improve monetary policy focus and budget predictability.

articles.title: BHEL wins ₹1,500 crore order from SAIL for Burnpur power plant
articles.summary: Bharat Heavy Electricals Ltd received a Letter of Acceptance from Steel Authority of India Limited for a captive power plant at IISCO Steel Plant, Burnpur, valued at ₹1,200-1,500 crore. Shares of Bharat Heavy Electricals Ltd ended marginally higher on Tuesday, February 17, by 0.11% at ₹262.80 on the NSE.

articles.title: Twirtles bets on protein and micronutrient snacking for next phase of growth
articles.summary: Arjun Veer Singh, Co-Founder of Twirtles, said the protein trend has gone mainstream beyond gym users. The company sees an opportunity to change the perception that healthy snacks lack taste by offering clean-label products with transparent ingredient sourcing.

articles.title: Lay’s rolls out new brand identity in India
articles.summary: The brand refresh is part of PepsiCo's largest global redesign in the brand’s nearly 100-year history & was first announced in October 2025.

articles.title: China AI startup Moonshot targets $10 billion valuation
articles.summary: Moonshot, backed by Alibaba and Tencent, aims for a $10B valuation. Its Kimi K2.5 AI leads in China but trails Zhipu and Minimax in value and commercialisation.

articles.title: Dabur elevates Mohit Malhotra as Global CEO; appoints Herjit Bhalla to lead India business
articles.summary: Dabur India Limited appoints Mohit Malhotra as Global Chief Executive Officer and Herjit S Bhalla as Chief Executive Officer - India Business, following steady Q3 growth driven by rural demand.

articles.title: Gold favoured over silver, copper likely to stay under pressure: Saxobank’s Ole Hansen
articles.summary: Copper prices have dropped to six-week lows, nearly 15% below January’s record highs, as rising global inventories and soft near-term demand weigh on sentiment. Ole Hansen, Head of Commodity Strategy at Saxo Bank, says the market is witnessing a mismatch between short-term supply conditions and the stronger long-term demand outlook.

articles.title: Hexaware launches open RapidX platform, integrates with Replit to speed up AI-driven software development

If it is the latter, and it must be, the platforms, pedagogy, and policies we choose in 2026 will shape the decade.
